description: President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariff push is already hitting New York’s economy, with falling Canadian tourism and cross-border shopping driving down sales tax revenue, Governor Kathy Hochul said.
title: Hochul Says Trump’s Tariffs Are Already Hurting New York Economy

description: US officials have told their UK counterparts they’ll discuss Britain’s proposal to reduce tariffs below 10%, but warned them President Donald Trump may decide that number is his permanent baseline for all countries, according to British officials familiar with the matter.
title: UK Gets Mixed Signals From US on Whether 10% Tariff Is Permanent

description: Deloitte LLP is planning to lay off employees on its government consulting team, according to people familiar with a call between executives and workers on Thursday.
title: Deloitte to Lay Off Government Consultants Amid Spending Cuts

description: US President Donald Trump said he believed that Iran was willing to engage in direct talks over its nuclear program, a day after Tehran indicated it would be willing to negotiate through intermediaries.
title: Trump Says He Thinks Iran Is Game for Direct Nuclear Talks

description: French President Emmanuel Macron was quick to respond to US President Donald Trump’s punitive tariffs on the European Union by urging businesses in the world’s largest trading bloc to halt spending on the US.
title: Macron Issues a Corporate Call to Arms: EU Stop Investing in US

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy editor Matthew Boesler looks at the cloudy forecast from economists after new tariffs were rolled out. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Where Trump Sees Tariff Boom, Many Economists See Gloom

description: A federal judge said he’s weighing whether to cite Trump administration officials for contempt for violating his order to immediately halt deportations of Venezuelans suspected of being gang members.
title: Judge Weighs Contempt Order for Trump Officials Over Deportations

description: Denmark’s top diplomats stood up to US President Donald Trump over his encroachment on Greenland, effectively ending a policy of quiet diplomacy they had hoped would make the issue go away.
title: Denmark Sheds Quiet Diplomacy in Pushback to US Over Greenland

description: The Pentagon’s inspector general will conduct an investigation of the Signal group chat where Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and other Trump administration officials discussed details of an impending attack on Houthi militants in Yemen.
title: Pentagon Watchdog to Investigate Signal Chat on Houthi Attack

description: The Trump administration is ordering state education officials to confirm the elimination of all diversity, equity, and inclusion programs or risk losing federal funding.
title: Trump Administration Threatens US Public School Funding Over DEI

description: Elon Musk is expected to step back from his role leading the Department of Government Efficiency once his 130-day period as a temporary adviser to President Donald Trump has lapsed, but the billionaire will still wield significant influence over the federal cost-cutting effort and remain a Trump confidant after his formal departure, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Musk’s White House Role Is Ending But His Influence Will Remain

description: After a court ordered the Internal Revenue Service to rehire some 7,000 probationary workers, the employees were put on administrative leave – kept on the federal payroll, but not back at work.
title: IRS Recalls Fired Workers as April 15 Tax Deadline Crush Looms

description: The White House is floating the idea of potentially launching a tariff investigation into critical minerals imports, causing further confusion on a key market prioritized by President Donald Trump.
title: Clarity Sought on Critical Minerals as US Floats Trade Probe

description: Donald Trump’s sweeping tariff announcement sent foreign leaders racing to cut deals with the president for lower duties on their exports to the US. The negotiating window may be smaller than they think.
title: Trump's 10% Minimum Tariff Makes It Harder for Nations Seeking a Deal

description: Former US tax officials urged the US Justice Department not to dismantle its tax division in an agency-wide reorganization, warning that such a move would hobble enforcement.
title: DOJ Is Urged Not to Dissolve Its Tax Division in Restructuring

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre pledged to remove the federal sales tax on new Canadian-made cars, offering his response to the Trump administration’s auto tariffs while trying to shore up support from workers whose jobs are at risk.
title: Made-in-Canada Cars to Be Sales-Tax Free, Conservatives Promise

description: The US Department of Education is launching a rulemaking process that could see the agency overhaul multiple federal student aid programs, the latest in a series of steps by President Donald Trump to reshape an agency that administers loans to millions of American borrowers.
title: Education Department Moves to Revamp Student Debt Programs

description: Some of the elite universities under the president’s scrutiny educated him and his cabinet secretaries.
title: Here’s Where Trump’s Cabinet Studied. Some Schools Are in His Sights

description: The US Department of Housing and Urban Development intends to leave its aging Brutalist building in Washington, DC.
title: Housing Agency Aims to Relocate Its DC Headquarters

description: The US stock market is down almost 10% since President Donald Trump’s inauguration, marking the worst 10-week start under a new president since George W. Bush in 2001 during the height of the dot-com selloff.
title: Trump’s Second Term Brings Worst Stock Market Start Since 2001

description: The Trump administration denied parole to a Russian scientist working at Harvard University, saying she is a threat to US security.
title: Trump Administration Denies Parole to Harvard Scientist From Russia, Citing Threat to US Security

description: The US and Democratic Republic of Congo are preparing a minerals and security partnership, President Donald Trump’s senior adviser for Africa said after meeting with President Felix Tshisekedi Thursday.
title: Trump Envoy Says US-Congo Mining and Security Deal Moving Ahead

description: Beijing’s ambitions in space pose “an incredible threat,” targeting satellites as first to be shot down in any conflict between the US and China, the head of the US Space Force warned Thursday.
title: US Satellites Risk Attack in a War With China, Space Chief Says

description: Mexico plans to continue negotiations with the US on steel and auto tariffs even as President Claudia Sheinbaum’s government celebrates its preferential treatment compared to other nations slammed by US President Donald Trump’s new duties.
title: Sheinbaum Dispatches Trade Chief to Washington for Tariff Talks

description: French President Emmanuel Macron urged companies to pause investments in the US after President Donald Trump announced tariffs on the European Union and other regions.
title: France’s Macron Urges EU Companies to Pause US Investments

description: Harvard University took disciplinary action against a pro-Palestinian student group for violating campus rules a day after the Trump administration threatened to scrap as much as $9 billion in federal funding for the school over its handling of antisemitism.
title: Harvard Cracks Down on Pro-Palestine Group After Funding Threat

description: Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis plans to meet with business associations next week to discuss the impact of new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.
title: Portugal Economy Minister to Meet Business Groups on US Tariffs

description: Iran has faced suspicion for decades over its nuclear ambitions and whether it’s developing the capability to fire an atomic weapon.
title: How Close Is Iran to a Nuclear Weapon as Trump Pushes for a Deal?

description: The US risks being caught between slowing growth and rising prices as a result of the sweeping tariff plans unveiled Wednesday by the Trump administration, according to the president of Apollo Global Management Inc.
title: Apollo’s Zelter Warns US Risks Recession, Stagflation on Tariffs

description: Canada’s exports to its biggest customer, the US, as well as other countries plunged in February, as threats and implementation of the Trump administration’s tariffs started to redraw global trading flows.
title: Canada Trade Balance Flips to Deficit as Tariff Threats Grow

description: Donald Trump’s decision to boost tariffs on almost every country will deal a blow to China’s economy. But it’s also handing Xi Jinping a rare opening to deepen relationships across the board, including with key US allies in Asia and beyond.
title: Trump Gives China’s Xi a Chance to Win Over World Hit by Tariffs

description: The Trump administration’s efforts to shrink the US government amounted to more than 280,000 planned layoffs of federal workers and contractors across 27 agencies over the past two months, according to data from outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas.
title: DOGE-Related Plans to Cut Jobs Top 280,000 in Challenger Report

description: Thailand and India signed a strategic partnership, vowing to cooperate on defense and accelerate a key infrastructure project that’s set to link the world’s most-populous nation with neighboring Southeast Asia.
title: Thailand, India to Elevate Ties as Modi Attends Regional Summit

description: Russia is still counting on US President Donald Trump to deliver an acceptable peace deal in Ukraine, though it’s prepared to continue the war if talks fail, according to people in Moscow familiar with the matter.
title: Putin Is Betting Trump Will Deliver Ukraine Concessions He Wants

description: France and Germany are pushing for a more robust reaction to US President Donald Trump’s tariff measures, advocating for a forceful retaliation that could strengthen the EU’s negotiating position.
title: Germany and France Push for a More Aggressive Tariff Response

description: Spain plans €14.1 billion ($15.6 billion) of aid and financing in response to the tariffs imposed by the US, while also urging the European Union to create a fund for affected industries, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Announces €14 Billion to Mitigate US Tariffs

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams will run for reelection as an independent, forgoing the Democratic primary as he grapples with the fallout of a recently dropped federal bribery case.
title: NYC Mayor Adams to Run for Reelection as an Independent

description: Britain’s trade secretary expressed confidence in reducing the new 10% tariff imposed on the country’s exports by Donald Trump, putting pressure on UK officials locked in talks with the White House over a deal to bring the two economies closer.
title: UK Believes Trump’s 10% Tariff Can Be Reduced in US Trade Deal

description: If Benjamin Netanyahu thought his closeness to Donald Trump would spare Israel from high US tariffs, he was wrong.
title: Israel’s Closeness to Trump Fails to Spare it From High Tariffs

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Gaza Death Toll Rises as Netanyahu Presses On

description: Singapore Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong ruled out any immediate retaliation after the US imposed a 10% baseline global tariff, indicating officials will seek talks over levies which threaten to have a “significant impact” on the city-state’s economy.
title: Singapore Won’t Retaliate Against US Tariffs, Seeks Engagement

description: The US’s decision to slap Switzerland with a 31% tariff leaves the country with a higher levy than anticipated, according the Swiss National Bank Governing Board member Petra Tschudin.
title: Trump’s Swiss Tariffs Higher Than Expected, SNB’s Tschudin Says

description: US President Donald Trump imposed a 50% reciprocal tariff on the tiny southern African mountain kingdom of Lesotho, the highest levy for any sovereign nation.
title: Trump Targets African Kingdom With Highest Tariff in the World

description: France is pushing for the European Union to hit US tech companies in response to President Donald Trump’s tariffs, in a move that would broaden the trade war to the vast services sector.
title: France Eyes US Big Tech in EU Retaliation to Trump’s Tariffs

description: The European Union needs to scale back its dependence on US military equipment as it digests the impact of President Donald Trump’s decision to hit trade partners with punishing tariffs, the bloc’s top foreign policy official said.
title: Europe Must Diversify Defense From US, EU’s Top Diplomat Says

description: Hungary will on Thursday start the legal procedure to exit the International Criminal Court, a senior official in Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government said.
title: Hungary Set to Start Process of Exiting ICC, Minister Says

description: President Donald Trump’s new reciprocal tariffs are set to hit some of the world’s poorest nations the hardest, putting their labor-intensive export industries at risk and diminishing one of the US’s biggest economic advantages over rival China.
title: Trump Tariffs Are ‘Disaster’ for the World’s Poorest Countries

description: “Tariff king.” A “big abuser” of tariffs. A “very high tariff nation.” US President Donald Trump has repeatedly made it clear over the years what he thinks of India’s protectionist trade policies.
title: What Trump’s Reciprocal Tariffs Mean for India

description: More than a dozen countries set for US reciprocal tariffs may face slightly higher levies than they first expected.
title: White House Annex Shows Slight Tariff Level Changes for Some

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s AD coalition led the opposition Socialists by a margin of 2 percentage points in an opinion poll, RTP reported on its website.
title: Portuguese Prime Minister’s Coalition Leads in Poll, RTP Reports

description: Trade tariffs announced by President Donald Trump affirm the urgency to negotiate a new bilateral and mutually beneficial trade agreement with the US, South Africa’s Presidency said.
title: South Africa Says US Tariffs Affirm Need for Bilateral Trade Deal

description: South Africa’s ruling coalition risks unraveling after a dispute between its main members over proposed tax increases deepened, pummeling the rand.
title: South Africa’s Coalition Teeters as Budget Shows Widening Rift

description: President Donald Trump’s return to the White House this year was identified in a new survey as one of Southeast Asia’s top three geopolitical worries.
title: Trump Presidency a Key Concern for Southeast Asia, Survey Shows

description: The US has banned government personnel based in China from having romantic or sexual relationships with Chinese citizens, the Associated Press reported citing people familiar with the matter.
title: US Bans Staff in China From Romantic Ties With Citizens, AP Says

description: China said it has detained three Filipino nationals suspected of spying, a move that could further strain ties between Beijing and Manila.
title: China Detains Three Filipinos for Alleged Spying as Ties Fray

description: President Donald Trump’s administration calculated its raft of new tariffs primarily based on existing trade balances — a departure from pledges to match the tariff rates and other trade barriers from other countries.
title: Trump’s ‘Reciprocal’ Tariff Formula Is All About Trade Deficits

description: In French legal circles, there’s a tightly knit group of eminent white-collar-crime lawyers who act as magnets for high-profile defendants from Nicolas Sarkozy to Swiss banking behemoth UBS Group AG.
title: Le Pen’s Legal Fate Rides on Deputy Mayor From a Mountain Town

description: In President Donald Trump’s original trade war, it mattered who your friends were. Not this time.
title: From Friend to Foe, Trump Shows Little Mercy in New Tariff Blitz

description: In justifying new tariffs customized to punish US trading partners for practices he sees as putting US manufacturers at a disadvantage, President Donald Trump has focused particular ire on value-added taxes. VATs are used by most countries but not by the US.
title: Trump Loathes VATs. Do They Really Put US Exporters at a Disadvantage?

description: The European Union, the US’s largest trading partner, vowed to retaliate after President Donald Trump announced sweeping tariffs against the bloc in his bid to dismantle the global trading system.
title: EU Vows to Respond With Countermeasures to Trump’s 20% Tariffs

description: Thailand is prepared to deal with the fallout of the 36% so-called reciprocal tariff imposed by the Trump administration, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said, adding that the Southeast Asian country would hold talks with the US to lower the levy.
title: Thailand PM Says Prepared to Deal With US Tariffs, Plans Talks

description: Kia Corp. is aiming to sell more electric vehicles in Europe as President Donald Trump’s auto tariffs and anti-EV policies cloud the outlook in the US.
title: Kia CEO Looks to Europe as Trump’s Tariffs Cloud US Outlook

description: Japan’s Trade Minister said the Trump administration’s latest tariff broadside is extremely regrettable and pushed for an exemption, hours after the US announced new levies on Japan that were higher than expected.
title: Japan Calls Trump’s 24% Tariff Regrettable, Pushes for Exemption

description: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Rebecca Jones talks to government reporter Ben Westcott about what to expect from the campaign
title: How Trump, Taxes and Bills Will Impact Australia’s Election

description: The Israeli army carried out multiple airstrikes in different parts of Syria on Wednesday, including the capital Damascus, and “almost completely destroyed” a military airport in another major city as Israel continues to degrade the war-torn country’s military capabilities.
title: Israeli Airstrikes Pound Syrian Military Airbase, Hit Damascus

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim is poised to extend anti-graft commission head Azam Baki’s term, people familiar with the matter said, despite criticism by non-governmental organizations about the appointment process and allegations by politicians and others that the agency practices selective prosecution.
title: Malaysia PM Anwar Plans to Extend Anti-Graft Agency Chief’s Term

description: President Donald Trump slapped India with some of the highest tariff rates imposed on any major US trading partner, saying his good personal ties with Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not affect his decision.
title: Trump Piles Pressure on ‘Friend’ Modi With 26% Tariff on India

description: US trade policies and nations’ responses to them could have a “chilling effect” on global business investment and household spending, though Australia’s financial system is well placed to weather such a storm, the Reserve Bank said in a half-yearly review.
title: RBA Sees Banks as Resilient to ‘Chilling Effect’ of US Tariffs

description: Lawmakers will hold a long-awaited hearing for President Donald Trump’s nomination to run NASA on April 9, paving the way for billionaire fintech entrepreneur Jared Isaacman to take the helm of the space agency.
title: Billionaire Jared Isaacman to Go Before Senate for NASA Hearing

description: Canada and Mexico escaped President Donald Trump’s new round of tariff announcements, a relief for businesses and investors in the two biggest US trading partners.
title: Canada and Mexico, Early Trump Targets, Dodge The Worst of New Tariff Salvo

description: South Korea’s interim leader Han Duck-soo urged officials to actively engage in negotiations with the US after President Donald Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs on trading partners that included higher duties for Seoul.
title: South Korea Holds Emergency Meeting to Respond to US Tariffs
